member.summary: A rolling hasher for . may be reused

member.name: M:VCDiff.Encoders.RollingHash.#ctor(System.Int32)
member.summary: Manually creates a rolling hash instance for use with a . This object must be disposed because it allocates pinned memory that will never be garbage collected if it is not disposed.
member.param: The window size to use for this hashing instance.

member.name: P:VCDiff.Encoders.RollingHash.WindowSize
member.summary: The window size for this rolling hash.

member.name: M:VCDiff.Encoders.RollingHash.Hash(System.Byte*,System.Int32)
member.summary:
Generate a new hash from the bytes
The formula for calculating h is h(0) = 1 h(n) = SUM {i=0}^{n-1} c^{n - i - 1} S[i]
where n is the length of S, and c is kMult.
In code, h(n) = Sum(i: 0, n: len - 1, i => kMult ** (len - i - 1) span[i])
The final result is then MODded using binary and with kBase.

member.name: M:VCDiff.Encoders.RollingHash.UpdateHash(System.UInt64,System.Byte,System.Byte)
member.summary: Rolling update for the hash First byte must be the first bytee that was used in the data that was last encoded new byte is the first byte position + Size
member.param: the original hash
the original byte of the data for the first hash
the first byte of the new data to hash

member.name: M:VCDiff.Encoders.RollingHash.Dispose
member.summary:
Dispose the rolling hash instance.
You must always dispose a manually created hashing instance, or memory leaks will occur. For performance purposes,

member.name: T:VCDiff.Encoders.VcEncoder
member.summary: A simple VCDIFF Encoder class.

member.name: M:VCDiff.Encoders.VcEncoder.#ctor(System.IO.Stream,System.IO.Stream,System.IO.Stream,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,VCDiff.Encoders.RollingHash)
member.summary: Creates a new VCDIFF Encoder. The input streams will not be closed once this object is disposed.
member.param: The dictionary (sourceStream file).
The target to create the diff from.
The stream to write the diff into.
The maximum buffer size for window chunking in megabytes (MiB).

The block size to use. Must be a power of two. No match smaller than this block size will be identified. Increasing blockSize by a factor of two will halve the amount of memory needed for the next block table, and will halve the setup time for a new BlockHash. However, it also doubles the minimum match length that is guaranteed to be found.
Blocksizes that are n mod 32 = 0 are AVX2 accelerated. Blocksizes that are n mod 16 = 0 are SSE2 accelerated, if supported. 16 is a good default for most scenarios, but you should use a block size of 32 or 64 for very similar data, or to optimize for speed.
The minimum size of a string match that is worth putting into a COPY. This must be bigger than twice the block size.

Manually provide a instance that can be reused for multiple encoding instances of the same block size.
If you provide a instance, you must dispose of it yourself.
member.exception: If an invalid blockSize or chunkSize is used..

member.name: M:VCDiff.Encoders.VcEncoder.Encode(System.Boolean,VCDiff.Shared.ChecksumFormat)
member.summary: Calculate and write a diff for the file.
member.param: Whether to output in SDCH interleaved diff format.
Whether to include Adler32 checksums for encoded data windows. If interleaved is true, is not supported.
member.returns: if successful, if the sourceStream or target are zero-length.
member.exception: If interleaved is true, and is chosen.

member.name: M:VCDiff.Encoders.VcEncoder.EncodeAsync(System.Boolean,VCDiff.Shared.ChecksumFormat)
member.summary:
Calculate and write a diff for the file.
This method is only asynchronous for the initial buffering of the sourceStream into memory. Writing to the output stream will still occur synchronously. It is recommended you use the synchronous method for most use cases.
member.param: Whether to output in SDCH interleaved diff format.
Whether to include Adler32 checksums for encoded data windows. If interleaved is true, is not supported.
member.returns: if successful, if the sourceStream or target are zero-length.
member.exception: If interleaved is true, and is chosen.
